summary.span: 表示提供对 XML 数据进行快速、非缓存、只进访问的读取器。

span.span: Represents a reader that provides fast, non-cached, forward-only access to XML data.

summary.span: 从 .NET Framework 2.0 开始，建议改用 类。

span.span: Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you use the class instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 提供对 XML 数据的流的只进、 只读访问。 provides forward-only, read-only access to a stream of XML data. 当前节点指读取器所处的节点。The current node refers to the node on which the reader is positioned. 读取器高级使用任何读取方法和属性反映当前节点的值。The reader is advanced using any of the read methods and properties reflect the value of the current node. 此类实现并且符合 W3C 可扩展标记语言 (XML) 1.0 和 XML 建议中的命名空间。This class implements and conforms to the W3C Extensible Markup Language (XML) 1.0 and the Namespaces in XML recommendations. `XmlTextReader` 提供以下功能：`XmlTextReader` provides the following functionality: - 强制实施格式正确的 XML 的规则。Enforces the rules of well-formed XML. - `XmlTextReader` 不提供数据验证。`XmlTextReader` does not provide data validation. - 检查`DocumentType`节点都是格式正确。Checks that `DocumentType` nodes are well-formed. `XmlTextReader` 检查为标准格式 DTD，但不会验证使用 DTD。`XmlTextReader` checks the DTD for well-formedness, but does not validate using the DTD. - 节点其中是`XmlNodeType.EntityReference`，单个空`EntityReference`将返回节点 (即，属性是`String.Empty`)。For nodes where is `XmlNodeType.EntityReference`, a single empty `EntityReference` node is returned (that is, the property is `String.Empty`). > [!NOTE] > 在 DTD 中的实体的实际声明称为`Entity`节点。The actual declarations of entities in the DTD are called `Entity` nodes. 在这些节点到引用数据中时，它们被称为`EntityReference`节点。When you refer to these nodes in your data, they are called `EntityReference` nodes. - 不展开默认属性。Does not expand default attributes. 因为`XmlTextReader`不执行额外的检查所需的数据验证，它提供快速良好分析器。Because the `XmlTextReader` does not perform the extra checks required for data validation, it provides a fast well-formedness parser. 若要执行数据验证，请使用验证。To perform data validation, use a validating . 用于读取 XML 数据从，使用。To read XML data from an , use . `XmlTextReader` 引发的 XML 分析错误。`XmlTextReader` throws an on XML parse errors. 引发异常后的读取器的状态不是可预测的。After an exception is thrown the state of the reader is not predictable. 例如，报告的节点类型可能不同于当前节点的实际节点类型。For example, the reported node type may be different than the actual node type of the current node. 使用属性检查读取器是否处于错误状态。Use the property to check whether a reader is in error state. ## 安全注意事项Security Considerations 以下是使用时要考虑的事项类。The following are things to consider when using the class. - 引发的异常可能会泄漏你不希望的路径信息冒泡由应用程序。Exceptions thrown the can disclose path information that you do not want bubbled up to the application. 应用程序必须捕获异常并进行相应的处理。Your applications must catch exceptions and process them appropriately. - 默认情况下启用 DTD 处理。DTD processing is enabled by default. 禁用 DTD 处理，如果你担心拒绝服务问题或如果您在处理不可信的源。Disable DTD processing if you are concerned about Denial of Service issues or if you are dealing with untrusted sources. 设置属性禁用 DTD 处理。Set the property to to disable DTD processing. 如果启用了 DTD 处理，可以使用 限制 可以访问的资源。If you have DTD processing enabled, you can use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 还可以设计应用程序以使 XML 处理受内存和时间的约束。You can also design your application so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，在 ASP.NET 应用程序中配置超时限制。For example, configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET application. - XML 数据可以包括对外部资源，如 DTD 文件的引用。XML data can include references to external resources such as a DTD file. 默认情况下，外部资源使用没有用户凭据的 对象进行解析。By default external resources are resolved using an object with no user credentials. 通过执行下列操作之一，可以使此操作更加安全：You can secure this further by doing one of the following: - 通过将 属性设置为 对象限制 可访问的资源。Restrict the resources that the can access by setting the property to an object. - 通过将 属性设置为 ，不允许 `null` 打开任何外部资源。Do not allow the to open any external resources by setting the property to `null`. - XML 数据可以包含大量属性、命名空间声明、嵌套元素等，需要大量的时间来处理。XML data can contain a large number of attributes, namespace declarations, nested elements and so on that require a substantial amount of time to process. 将发送到的输入的大小限制、 创建自定义 IStream 实现并将其提供。To limit the size of the input that is sent to the , create a custom IStream implementation and supply it the . - 方法可以用于处理大型数据流。The method can be used to handle large streams of data. 此方法一次读取少量的字符，而不是为整个值分配单个字符串。This method reads a small number of characters at a time instead of allocating a single string for the whole value. - 默认情况下不展开常规实体。By default general entities are not expanded. 常规实体在调用 方法时展开。General entities are expanded when you call the method.

remarks.format:
## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此构造函数分析的 XML 片段作为给定的字符串。This constructor parses the given string as a fragment of XML. 如果 XML 片段的元素或属性，你可以绕过格式正确的 XML 文档的根级别规则。If the XML fragment is an element or attribute, you can bypass the root level rules for well-formed XML documents. 下表列出有效值`fragType`。The following table lists valid values for `fragType`. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|片段可能包含Fragment May Contain| |-----------------|--------------------------| |`Element`|任何有效的元素的内容 （例如，元素、 注释、 处理指令、 CDATA 部分、 文本和实体引用的任何组合）。Any valid element content (for example, any combination of elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, text, and entity references).

还可以提供 XML 声明。An XML declaration can also be supplied. 这允许你指定编码为 XML 片段中，而不是无需将其设置上对象。This allows you to specify the encoding for the XML fragment, rather than having to set it on the object.| |`Attribute`|属性 （引号内的部分） 的值。The value of an attribute (the part inside the quotes).| |`Document`|整个 XML 文档的内容。The contents of an entire XML document. 这会强制文档级别规则。This enforces document level rules.| 读取器使用下列方法确定的流的编码。The reader uses the following to determine the encoding of the stream. 1. 检查属性来确定编码。Checks the property to determine the encoding. 2. 如果`Encoding`属性是`null`，读取器检查流的开始位置的字节顺序标记。If the `Encoding` property is `null`, the reader checks for a byte-order mark at the beginning of the stream. 3. 如果`Encoding`属性是`null`，并且在找到任何字节顺序标记，则读取器认为采用 utf-8 编码流。If the `Encoding` property is `null`, and no byte-order mark is found, the reader assumes the stream is encoded in UTF-8.

span.span: is not an Element, Attribute, or Document .
is .

## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此构造函数分析的 XML 片段作为给定的字符串。This constructor parses the given string as a fragment of XML. 如果 XML 片段的元素或属性，你可以绕过格式正确的 XML 文档的根级别规则。If the XML fragment is an element or attribute, you can bypass the root level rules for well-formed XML documents. 此构造函数可以处理从返回的字符串。This constructor can handle strings returned from . 下表列出有效值`fragType`和如何读取器分析每个不同节点类型。The following table lists valid values for `fragType` and how the reader parses each of the different node types. |XmlNodeTypeXmlNodeType|片段可能包含Fragment May Contain| |-----------------|--------------------------| |元素Element|任何有效的元素的内容 （例如，元素、 注释、 处理指令、 CDATA 部分、 文本和实体引用的任何组合）。Any valid element content (for example, any combination of elements, comments, processing instructions, CDATA sections, text, and entity references).

还可以提供 XML 声明。An XML declaration can also be supplied. 这允许你指定编码为 XML 片段中，而不是无需将其设置上对象。This allows you to specify the encoding for the XML fragment, rather than having to set it on the object.| |特性Attribute|属性 （引号内的部分） 的值。The value of an attribute (the part inside the quotes).| |DocumentDocument|整个 XML 文档的内容。The contents of an entire XML document. 这会强制文档级别规则。This enforces document level rules.| ## Examples 下面的示例分析 XML 片段。The following example parses an XML fragment. 它使用`XmlParserContext`及其来处理命名空间解析。It uses the `XmlParserContext` and its to handle namespace resolution. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 联网的 XML 文档的聚合使用各种 W3C 标准包含机制的数据块组成，因此包含来自不同位置的节点。A networked XML document is comprised of chunks of data aggregated using various W3C standard inclusion mechanisms and therefore contains nodes that come from different places. DTD 实体是该示例，但这并不限于 Dtd。DTD entities are an example of this, but this is not limited to DTDs. 基 URI 将指示你这些节点来自何处。The base URI tells you where these nodes came from. 如果没有要返回的节点没有基 URI （例如，它们已分析从内存中字符串），`String.Empty`返回。If there is no base URI for the nodes being returned (for example, they were parsed from an in-memory string), `String.Empty` is returned. ## Examples 下面的示例显示每个节点的基 URI。The following example displays the base URI for each of the nodes. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此属性可以随时更改，将在下一步读取操作上的生效。This property can be changed at any time and takes effect on the next read operation. > [!NOTE] > 如果用于构造，若要规范化属性值，`Normalization`必须设置为`true`。If the is used to construct an , to normalize attribute values, `Normalization` must be set to `true`. 如果`Normalization`设置为`false`，这还将禁用的字符范围检查数字实体。If `Normalization` is set to `false`, this also disables character range checking for numeric entities. 因此，，这类字符实体`�`，允许。As a result, character entities, such as `�`, are allowed. 下面介绍属性值的标准化：The following describes attribute value normalization: - 对于字符引用，将所引用的字符追加到属性值。For a character reference, append the referenced character to the attribute value. - 对于实体引用，循环处理该实体的替换文本。For an entity reference, recursively process the replacement text of the entity. - 对于一个空白字符 （#x x20、 #xD、 #xA、 #x x9），将追加到已标准化的值的 #x x20。For a white space character (#x20, #xD, #xA, #x9), append #x20 to the normalized value. （仅单个 #x x20 追加外部分析实体的一部分或内部分析的实体的文本的实体值"#xD #xA"序列中）。(Only a single #x20 is appended for a "#xD#xA" sequence that is part of an external parsed entity or the literal entity value of an internal parsed entity.) - 通过将其他字符追加到已标准化的值处理这些字符。Process other characters by appending them to the normalized value. - 如果已声明的值不是 CDATA，放弃所做的任何前导和尾随空格 (#x x20) 字符和空格 (#x x20) 字符序列替换为一个空格 (#x x20) 字符。If the declared value is not CDATA, discard any leading and trailing space (#x20) characters and replace sequences of space (#x20) characters with a single space (#x20) character. `XmlTextReader`仅执行属性或 CDATA 规范化。The `XmlTextReader` only performs attribute or CDATA normalization. 它并不特定于 DTD 的规范化除非包装内`XmlValidatingReader`。It does not do DTD-specific normalization unless wrapped within an `XmlValidatingReader`. 请参阅有关规范化的进一步讨论 W3C XML 1.0 建议。Refer to the W3C XML 1.0 recommendation for further discussion on normalization. ## Examples 下面的示例显示读取器行为标准化开启然后又关闭。The following example shows reader behavior with normalization turned on and then off. [!code-cpp[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/CPP/readnormal.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/CS/readnormal.cs#1)] [!code-vb[XmlTextReader.Normalization#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Data/XmlTextReader.Normalization/VB/readnormal.vb#1)]

DTD 处理是默认情况下启用的向后兼容性。DTD processing is enabled by default for backwards compatibility. 但是，除非你的应用程序需要 DTD 处理，应禁用此设置。However, unless your application requires DTD processing, you should disable this setting. 禁用 DTD 处理对避免受到某些拒绝服务攻击非常有用。Disabling DTD processing can be useful in preventing certain denial of service attacks. 如果设置为`true`，读取器引发时遇到任何 DTD 内容。If set to `true`, the reader throws an when any DTD content is encountered. 如果你启用了 DTD 处理，你需要注意： 包括来自受信任的源和可能的拒绝服务攻击的 Dtd。If you have DTD processing enabled, you need to be aware of including DTDs from untrusted sources and possible denial of service attacks. 使用来限制的资源，可以访问。Use the to restrict the resources that the can access. 还可以设计应用程序以使 XML 处理受内存和时间的约束。You can also design your application so that the XML processing is memory and time constrained. 例如，在 ASP.NET 应用程序中配置超时限制For example, configure time-out limits in your ASP.NET application

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 这是文本的最有效的方式来处理非常大的 XML 文档中嵌入流。This is the most efficient way to process very large streams of text embedded in an XML document. 而不是分配大的字符串对象`ReadChars`返回一次一个缓冲区的文本内容。Rather than allocating large string objects, `ReadChars` returns text content a buffer at a time. 此方法用于处理仅在元素节点上。This method is designed to work only on element nodes. 其他节点类型导致`ReadChars`返回`0`。Other node types cause `ReadChars` to return `0`. 在下面的 XML 中，如果读取器定位在开始标记上`ReadChars`返回`test`和将读取器定位在结束标记之后。In the following XML, if the reader is positioned on the start tag, `ReadChars` returns `test` and positions the reader after the end tag. ``` test ``` `ReadChars` 还具有以下功能：`ReadChars` has the following functionality: - 此方法用于处理仅限元素节点上。This method is designed to work on element nodes only. 其他节点类型导致`ReadChars`返回 0。Other node types cause `ReadChars` to return 0. - 此方法返回的实际字符内容。This method returns the actual character content. 没有尝试解析实体、 CDATA 或遇到的任何其他标记。There is no attempt to resolve entities, CDATA, or any other markup encountered. `ReadChars` 返回开始标记和结束标记，包括标记之间的所有内容。`ReadChars` returns everything between the start tag and the end tag, including markup. - `ReadChars` 将忽略不是格式良好的 XML 标记。`ReadChars` ignores XML markup that is not well-formed. 例如，当读取以下 XML 字符串`12`，`ReadChars`返回`12`。For example, when reading the following XML string `12`, `ReadChars` returns `12`. （它返回标记从匹配的元素对，且将忽略其他人。）(It returns markup from the matching element pair and ignores others.) - 此方法不执行任何规范化。This method does not do any normalization. - 当`ReadChars`已到达结尾的字符流，它将返回值 0 和读取器定位在结束标记之后。When `ReadChars` has reached the end of the character stream, it returns the value 0 and the reader is positioned after the end tag. - 方法使用时不可用，则读取属性`ReadChars`。Attribute read methods are not available while using `ReadChars`. 例如，使用以下 XML:For example, using the following XML: ``` some text ``` 读取器定位在``元素末尾的 while 循环。The reader is positioned on the `` element at the end of the while loop. ``` if (XmlNodeType.Element == reader.NodeType && "thing" == reader.Name) { while(0 != reader.ReadChars(buffer, 0, 1) { // Do something. // Attribute values are not available at this point. } } ``` ## Examples 下面的示例读入 XML 使用`ReadChars`。The following example reads in XML using `ReadChars`. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此方法的内容流式处理，将解码`Base64`内容，并返回已解码的二进制字节 (例如，内联`Base64`-编码的 GIF 图像) 到缓冲区。This method streams the content, decodes the `Base64` content, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline `Base64`-encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 可以连续调用此方法，以读取大的嵌入文本流。This method can be called successively to read large streams of embedded text. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521"MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展） 部分一个： 机制来指定以及描述 Internet 消息正文的格式"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以从在注释网站的请求获取 Rfc http://www.rfc-editor.org。You can obtain RFCs from the Request for Comments Web site at http://www.rfc-editor.org. > [!NOTE] > 不应访问的任何读取器属性之间调用方法，直到该方法返回值 0。You should not access any of the reader properties between calls to the method until the method returns the value 0. 此方法具有以下行为：This method has the following behavior: - 当它已达到它正在操作的字节流的末尾，则返回值 0。 returns the value 0 when it has reached the end of the byte stream it was operating on. 读取器定位在的第一个非内容节点上。The reader is positioned on the first non-content node. - 如果你请求更少，或者在当前位置保持的字节数比流中读取器剩余的精确数目。If you ask for fewer, or the exact number, of bytes than are left in the stream the reader remains in its current position. - 不支持对以下 XML 节点类型： `Element`， `XmlDeclaration`， `None`， `Document`， `DocumentType`， `Notation`， `Entity`， `DocumentFragment`。 is not supported on the following XML node types: `Element`, `XmlDeclaration`, `None`, `Document`, `DocumentType`, `Notation`, `Entity`, `DocumentFragment`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 此方法读取元素内容，使用 Base64 编码进行解码并返回解码的二进制字节 （例如，内联 Base64 编码的 GIF 图像） 到缓冲区。This method reads the element content, decodes it using Base64 encoding, and returns the decoded binary bytes (for example, an inline Base64 encoded GIF image) into the buffer. 有关详细信息，请参阅 RFC 1521"MIME （多用途 Internet 邮件扩展） 部分一个： 机制来指定以及描述 Internet 消息正文的格式"。For more information, see RFC 1521, "MIME (Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions) Part One: Mechanisms for Specifying and Describing the Format of Internet Message Bodies". 你可以从在注释网站的请求获取 Rfc http://www.rfc-editor.org。You can obtain RFCs from the Request for Comments Web site at http://www.rfc-editor.org. 此方法只能读取简单内容元素。This method can only read simple-content elements. 该元素可以包含文本、 空白、 有效空白、 CDATA 节、 注释和处理指令。The element can contain text, white space, significant white space, CDATA sections, comments and processing instructions. 它还可以包含实体引用自动展开。It can also contain entity references, which are automatically expanded. 元素不能有子元素。The element cannot have child elements. 此方法是非常类似于方法，但它只能在元素节点类型上调用。This method is very similar to the method except that it can only be called on element node types. 如果`count`值高于在文档中，字节数是否等于在文档中，字节数或读取文档中的所有剩余字节，并返回读取的字节数。If the `count` value is higher than the number of bytes in the document, or if it is equal to the number of bytes in the document, the reads all the remaining bytes in the document and returns the number of bytes read. 下一步方法调用将返回零，并将读取器移动到节点以下。The next method call returns a zero and moves the reader to the node following the . 如果调用消耗了全部元素内容时之前，读取器的行为类似于第一个内容已被用尽，然后调用了方法。If you call before all of the element content is consumed, the reader may behave as if the first content was consumed and then the method was called. 这意味着读取器读取的所有文本，直到遇到 end 元素。This means that the reader reads all the text until the end element is encountered. 然后读取结束标记节点、 读取下一个节点，并在下一步的后续节点然后定位。It then reads the end tag node, reads the next node, and then positions itself on the next subsequent node. ## Examples 请参阅若要查看使用此方法的示例。See to see an example using this method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 如果定位在元素上，`ReadString`将所有文本、 有效空白，空白区域和`CData`部分节点类型在一起，并返回串联的数据作为元素内容。If positioned on an element, `ReadString` concatenates all text, significant white space, white space, and `CData` section node types together and returns the concatenated data as the element content. 它会停止时遇到任何标记，包括注释和处理指令。It stops when any markup is encountered, including comments and processing instructions. 这可以在混合内容模型中发生，也可以在读取元素结束标记时发生。This could occur in a mixed content model, or when an element end tag is read. 如果定位在一个文本节点上,`ReadString`执行相同的串联从文本节点到元素结束标记。If positioned on a text node, `ReadString` performs the same concatenation from the text node to the element end tag. 如果读取器定位在属性文本节点上，则 `ReadString` 与读取器定位在元素开始标记上时的功能相同。If the reader is positioned on an attribute text node, `ReadString` has the same functionality as if the reader were position on the element start tag. 它返回所有串联在一起的元素文本节点。It returns all the concatenated element text nodes. ## Examples 下面的示例显示了每个元素的文本内容。The following example displays the text content of each element. remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!NOTE] > 从.NET Framework 2.0 开始，我们建议你创建实例使用方法以利用新功能。Starting with the .NET Framework 2.0, we recommend that you create instances by using the method to take advantage of new functionality. 读取器使用`XmlResolver`解析到读取器加载的文件的位置，并解析 DTD 引用。The reader uses `XmlResolver` to resolve the location of the file loaded into the reader and also to resolve DTD references. 例如，如果 XML 包含 DOCTYPE 声明中，``读取器解析此外部文件，并确保 DTD 是格式正确。For example, if your XML included the DOCTYPE declaration, `` the reader resolves this external file and ensures that the DTD is well-formed. 读取器不使用 DTD 进行验证。The reader does not use the DTD for validation. 此属性可以随时更改，将在下一步读取操作上的生效。This property can be changed at any time and takes effect on the next read operation. 如果此属性设置为`null`，则不解析读取器遇到的任何外部 DTD 引用。If this property is set to `null`, any external DTD references encountered by the reader are not resolved. 在 1.1 版[!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)]，如果未设置此属性，应用程序的信任级别将确定的默认行为。In version 1.1 of the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)], if this property is not set, the trust level of the application determines the default behavior. `Fully trusted code:` 读取器使用默认使用没有用户凭据。`Fully trusted code:` The reader uses a default with no user credentials. 如果需要身份验证来访问网络资源，使用`XmlResolver`属性指定`XmlResolver`使用必要的凭据。If authentication is required to access a network resource, use the `XmlResolver` property to specify an `XmlResolver` with the necessary credentials. `Semi-trusted code:` `XmlResolver`属性设置为`null`。`Semi-trusted code:` The `XmlResolver` property is set to `null`. 不解析外部资源。External resources are not resolved. ## Examples 下面的示例使用`XmlResolver`属性指定访问网络的文件所需的凭据。The following example uses the `XmlResolver` property to specify the credentials necessary to access the networked file.
